Message.Title: Tuber Time With jon...
Message.Msg: Well, I see the spokesman/men for the right was/were hard at work again last night. Here’s an extremely informative post from that bastion of intellectual cogitation, jon3retired. Jon, based on both the subject matter of your post and the fact that you’ve apparently forgotten that you already offered up this pathetically lame attempt at humor just last week, perhaps your “retirement” should have been you retiring to bed instead of having that last 40 ounce Colt 45 last night. If it’s not Alzheimer’s that’s making you forget what you already posted, you should realize that “getting stupid” with consumption of spirits is not a good idea when you’re already really stupid to begin with! Last night’s political insight from jon: “Yep Geoff .. I think we have it now .. Minn .. lv66vette .. av8lover ... have better sun-tans than I do .. I guess I would too if I could parade the beach ... in a pair of speedo's .. but I sure wouldn't get mixed up like they did .. and put that ‘potato’ in the BACK .. instead of the front !! I can just imagine those sunbathers running and laughing till they cried.. the WELL TANNED DUMMY's .. signifing with A LOAD in the ‘seats’ of their Speedo's .. (chuckles)” Good job, jon - this post is a representative capsule of most all of your posts…you included a racist comment in the first sentence, followed by poor punctuation, misspelling (What exactly is “signifing?”, ending with the self-congratulatory, parenthetical, proclamation of how funny you were. (chuckles) Yeah, jon that was a real knee-slapper, alright! (tee-hee, giggles and winkie-faces) Now here’s Jon’s post of nine days ago, which he either liked so much that he repeated it, or was so waxed last night that he forgot he had already blessed us with his jocularity. “Mmm .. speaking of 2 idiots lv66vette - where's your twin ‘av8lover’ ?? I'm surprised you haven't activated him. Well, you two guys have a nice day today ... strolling the sunny beach .. signifying in your speedos, but remember .. put the potatos (sic) in the front dummies, not the "back" (chuckles)” Jon, I have no idea what your fixation with putting tubers in your shorts is all about, but attempting to re-circulate really old jokes that were totally lame to begin with and pretending that you created them is even more pathetic. That said, perhaps rather than stuffing your underwear with vegetables, you could alter your diet of alcohol and pork rinds long enough to actually ingest some healthy food to slow down your obvious cognitive decline and encourage focus and clarity. (Berries of all sorts are good for this, but ingesting them as Boone’s Farm won’t really help.) I mention this because of the glaring mistake in your second post above. You are apparently of a similar intellectual capacity as one of renown standard-bearers of you ideology, the inscrutable, Dan Quayle. You spelled potatoes as potatos. When he did that back in 1992, he mistakenly corrected a 12 year old boy, named William Figueroa. What the child said about Quayle, is an even more accurate description of you. “The young Figueroa crystallized the effects of this incident on Quayle's public image when he said that it ‘showed that the rumors about the vice president are true – that he's an idiot.’ Now, put some squash in your skivvies, stop vegetating, get back to your cubicle and get to work.

Topic.Title: New 52 wk High!

Message.Msg: Moving for round numbers I should think. Target for the short-term before earnings could be a nice round $40, but then when earnings are announced and they show that margins got squeezed from Apple rollout it could drop to $36-35. Actually, we would need the drop anyway to keep the long-term chart closer to a 45 degree angle instead of turning up and parabolic.

Topic.Title: New 52 wk High!

Message.Msg: YES!! Very exciting,, our next resistance level is $39.61.. On another note,, I noticed that the NEXT WAVE spectrum purchase is hitting a slight legal issue that won't mean much for AT&T's purchase but means a lot to the common stock holders of NEXT WAVE (WAVE). The agreement that was made between the 2 companies wasn't fair to the common stock and there was a lawsuit, The common stock owners are ending up with a better deal on an out of court setttlement. That is a huge gesture and win to me. I never have seen those types of lawsuits turn out positive for the common stock owners. So I'm very happy for them. It's going to be a good end to the week.

Topic.Title: New 52 wk High!

Message.Msg: Yeah, that resistance level will put us in line for a breakout over it to $40. In terms of looking at this as a long-term holding, I would then like to see that $4-5 drop after earnings to even out the slope of the line on the chart to more sustainable 40-45 degree angle. The price drop will also allow for better reinvestment price when the dividend is paid. I love to see the stock price soar like this, but I don't want it to get too far ahead of itself before the margins are confirmed and we have some guidance on the next earnings call.

Topic.Title: Obama admin knew embasy attack probable but did not protect staff

Message.Msg: Frustrated lawmakers are calling on the Obama administration to get its story straight on what happened in last week's deadly attack on the U.S. Consulate in Libya, with President Obama coming under pressure to address the American people about the evolving narrative. "You hate to think that the president would purposely mislead the American people, but it sure looks like it to me," House Armed Services Committee Chairman Buck McKeon, R-Calif., said. McKeon was among several top-ranking lawmakers who expressed frustration following a briefing with administration officials late Thursday. Sen. John McCain, R-Ariz., said he learned "nothing" from it, claiming the administration is still blaming an anti-Islam film on YouTube for the attack that killed four Americans including the U.S. ambassador. The White House has been sending mixed signals. Press Secretary Jay Carney for the first time Thursday called the strike terrorism. Obama, though, continued to cite the anti-Islam film when asked about the attack during a voter forum hosted by Univision. The attack was clearly pre-planned and could lead back to Al Qaeda or an affiliate. Obama, in his interview with Univision, did not say whether Al Qaeda might be involved, saying the matter is still under investigation. You hate to think that the president would purposely mislead the American people, but it sure looks like it McKeon told Fox News that it's time for Obama to address the American people about what's happening. "If he'd spend some time in Washington ... rather than traveling around ... to raise money and campaign for four more years of what -- yeah, I think it would be good if he did a little bit of what he's being paid to do," he said. Several concerns have been raised about the version of events being pushed by administration officials. Foremost, U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Susan Rice's claims that the attack was a "spontaneous" event triggered by protests in Cairo were challenged by claims out of Libya and intelligence sources that the strike was premeditated and possibly tied to a former Guantanamo inmate. Sources also said there was no major protest in Benghazi before the strike, which further challenged assertions that the strike was part of a demonstration spun out of control. Furthermore, Fox News has confirmed that the two former Navy SEALs killed in the attack were not working security for the State Department but were in Benghazi for a separate agency. And they were not initially at the consulate -- but a separate facility -- when the main building came under fire last Tuesday night. These details also appear to conflict with the account given by Rice on ABC's "This Week." She said: "We had a substantial security presence with our personnel. ... Tragically, two of the four Americans who were killed were there providing security. That was their function. And indeed, there were many other colleagues who were doing the same with them." Some lawmakers have called for an independent investigation, expressing concern about whether the administration is handling it appropriately. Following Thursday's briefing with Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and others, Sen. Bob Corker, R-Tenn., reportedly slammed the meeting as "the most useless, worthless briefing that I have attended in a long time." "It was like a one-hour filibuster with absolutely not one single bit of new information being brought forth," he said, according to Foreign Policy magazine. The briefing "if anything, built far greater distrust about what's happening than just answering questions. It was pretty unbelievable."

Topic.Title: NY State "busted"in $15 B Medicare Fraud !!

Message.Msg: No doubt it is fraud, occurring since 1990 and uncovered in 2010 and the current CMS director, Marilyn Tavenner (former HHR Secretary from Virginia--your home state) is taking a harder line with NY than the Republican Committee recommends. The Obama administration has made uncovering this type of fraud a priority. The amounts that some estimate are being lost to fraud in this system are staggering. I am glad it is finally being dealt with--by this administration and by Republicans in Congress. Fraud is not a partisan issue. I hope both parties are assiduous in eliminating, regardless of the party affiliation of whoever committed it. Lastly, your posts are barely comprehensible. The effort it must take to write so poorly seems painful. For a lover of the English language, your posts remind me of the smells that emanate from behind the stairwells of cheap Bourbon Street bars. If your name was e.e. cummings and it was 1920 and you were writing avant-garde poetry some might see you as a genius. But you're not and its not, so we see you for what you are: the most worthless poster on this MB. Considering your competition, that's quite a feat.

Topic.Title: Are you firing obama?

Message.Msg: Regardless of his constant blaming Bush for all his problems, this lying, stupid, fool is the person for responsible for the economy we have today and for the past three years. He was the one that promised that if we let him do the stimulus give away, buy GM and other companies he would kiss it and make it better. Well, now he can just kiss my a## because he has only made it worse and he is the leader, which in and of itself is a crock, and he has not kept his campaign pledges. Now, he is blaming Fast and Furious on Bush, when the program Bush tried was cancelled two years before Obama took office because it didn't work. Mr. Ego, pick one, Obama or his AG thought they were smarter. They got caught, failed and are now lying about the results and who caused it. Just like Little Timmy lied about how and why his taxes didn’t get paid. Then you have the lying sack of dung Harry that spreads lies and says he doesn’t need to prove any of his lies are true; and I thought Nut Job Nancy was bad. She can’t hold a candle to these fools.

Message.Msg: The US DID DO NOTHING wrong. We should have to apologize to anyone or make any excuses for holding the freedom of speech near and dear. Ever notice how people in this country make jokes about different religions, they complain about religion, they call religion evil, but because religion is this country is a believe system, not the law, they are allowed to do so under our Constitution. In the Middle East if you speak about another religion or against the dominant religion they will KILL you. If in America your wife, even if you go to church every Sunday cheats on you, you get a divorce or counseling, not stoned t death! The US did nothing wrong other than not protect our citizens working in a foreign land and having the false expectation that anyone is their government would protect them. These attacks are just an excuse for their actions and hoping that using religion as the excuse will stop the US from going after the perpetrators and it appears to be working rather well.

Topic.Title: Obama says he believes in redistribution

Message.Msg: When the government passes laws to take your money so that it can be shared with others it is no longer 'giving'. The government has the authority to collect taxes to support common activities and basic infrastructure building and improvements and defense of the nation and its borders. They don't have the authority to 'give' away the nations treasury.

Topic.Title: Obama says he believes in redistribution

Message.Msg: Most of the 'rich' are also those that have advanced technology, medicine, marketing skills, etc. to grow the basics of life style improvements for the people of this country and many others around the world. Why, if they are enhancing existing technologies, creating new products and employing more people should they not benefit from their work? Tax breaks did not make these people wealthy. The tax code may have allowed them to keep more of their money than is pleasant for you, but the laws that allow them to do so were written by the members of Congress you helped elect and reelect. The rich didn't create this problem by being intelligent, talented, or hardworking, but they helped create the problems you complain about due to the corrupt nature of the politicians in Washington. Don't blame the 'rich', blame the law writers and those that accept the payments of the rich to support them. They didn't and don't have to accept the offer to act in a corrupt manner, they have the opportunity to say no. And we have had more than ample opportunity to excuse them from office. It is time to excuse even more of them starting with the President.

Topic.Title: Obama reveals he doesn't know what national debt is and it is not his problem.

Message.Msg: He knows what the deficit is. He knows what the debt is. He knows where it is headed in the future. The issue is he doesn't care unless it gets in the way of his reelection and his future plans. We can only hope that people finally start to realize his real intentions and what a real life 'empty chair' we have on our hands. The man is not stupid, just evil.

Topic.Title: Are you firing obama?

Message.Msg: Didn't vote for him, will never vote for him. I have voted for Democrats over the years, but never for someone this corrupt and dishonest.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ...“The Chief Magistrate must almost of necessity be chosen by a party and stand pledged to its principles and measures, yet in his official action he should not be the President of a party only, but of the whole people of the United States.” – President James K. Polk “If you don’t think too good, don’t think too much.” – Ted Williams “Mitt Romney said if he had Mexican parents, he'd have a better shot of winning...But unfortunately Romney was tragically held back by being born of rich white people.” – Conan O’Brien “Two half philosophers will probably never a whole metaphysician make.” – Gaston Bachelard “When you see a man with a great deal of religion displayed in his shop window, you may depend upon it he keeps a very small stock of it within.” – Charles Spurgeon “Silence is foolish if we are wise, but wise if we are foolish.” – Charles Caleb Colton "Anti-American crowds have been protesting and burning American flags over that anti-Islamic film. And the U.S. is now bracing for more protests next week when the film comes out on Blu-ray." –Jay Leno “United we fall, divided we stand. Ode to a tri-pod.” – Anthony Lewis “If Galileo had said in verse (poetry) that the world moved, the inquisition might have left him alone." – anonymous "Mitt Romney was on 'Live With Kelly and Michael.' At one point Mitt was asked what he wears to bed. He said as little as possible. It's the same philosophy that Mitt has in regard to paying taxes." –Jimmy Kimmel “Man must develop his tendency towards the good.” – Immanuel Kant “It is dangerous for a national candidate to say anything people might remember.” – Eugene McCarthy “Today is the one-year anniversary of occupying Wall Street protests. Remember those? They stomped out greed forever." – Jimmy Kimmel “Education is the silver bullet. Education is everything. We don't need little changes, we need gigantic revolutionary changes. Schools should be palaces. Competition for the best teachers should be fierce. They should be getting six-figure salaries. Schools should be incredibly expensive for government and absolutely free of charge for its citizens, just like national defense. That is my position. I just haven't figured out how to do it yet.” – Aaron Sorkin

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ... “The flood of money that gushes into politics today is a pollution of democracy.” – Theodore White “What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.” – Abraham Lincoln "A lot of Republicans are blaming Obama for all of this because he's weak. Right, you know what, if we were attacked in Egypt, Libya, and Yemen, George Bush would know what to do. He’d invade Iraq.” – Bill Maher “The great object of Education should be commensurate with the object of life. It should be a moral one; to teach self-trust; to inspire the youthful man with an interest in himself; with a curiosity touching his own nature; to acquaint him with the resources of his mind, and to teach him that there is all his strength, and to inflame him with a piety towards the Grand Mind in which he lives.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson “Confucius say, ‘Crowded elevator smell different to midget’!.” "Mitt Romney is trailing in the polls. After being accused of being too vague, Romney's campaign team says they will start being more specific. When asked when, they said, 'Soon-ish.'" –Conan O'Brien “Few people even scratch the surface, much less exhaust the contemplation of their own experience.” – Randolph Bourne “For Sale: Parachute - Only used once, Never opened; small stain.” – unknown "All over the world people are chanting, 'Death to America.' Except in China, where they're chanting, 'Not until we get our money back.'" –Jay Leno “The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much it is whether we provide enough for those who have little.” – Franklin Delano Roosevelt “The weight of evidence for an extraordinary claim must be proportional to its strangeness.” – Pierre - Simon Laplace “Romney told us all about their sex life. Sometimes he and Ann turn off the lights and play 'find my tax returns’.” - Bill Maher “A peace is of the nature of a conquest; for then both parties nobly are subdued, and neither party loser.” – William Shakespeare “Sit down before fact with an open mind. Be prepared to give up every preconceived notion. Follow humbly wherever and to whatever abyss Nature leads or you learn nothing. Don’t push out figures when facts are going in the opposite direction.” – Hyman G. Rickover “A man has made at least a start on discovering the meaning of human life when he plants shade trees under which he knows full well he will never sit.” – D. Elton Trueblood “Have a good weekend, all.” “We don't pay taxes. Only the little people pay taxes.” – Leona Helmsley

Topic.Title: Obama says he believes in redistribution

Message.Msg: "Why, if they are enhancing existing technologies, creating new products and employing more people should they not benefit from their work?" Who said they shouldn't? How low do you think Oprah's tax rate needs to be to allow her to benefit from her work? You already think it should be half the rate I need to allow me to benefit from my work. How low does it need to be so she can benefit from her work? "Tax breaks did not make these people wealthy." Sure doesn't hurt. How low should Oprah's tax rate be? It's already 15% for unearned income (so we are using the term "work" loosely here). Should Oprah's tax rate be 10%? 5%? 1%? Lower? Maybe you'll answer. Romney won't. jj won't. Will you tell me how low of a tax rate Oprah needs?

Topic.Title: Obama admin knew embasy attack probable but did not protect staff

Message.Msg: Who's apologizing? The commercial does nothing but express our respect for all religions and inform people that the American government did not produce that video. Do you think stating American values is apologizing? Expressing our core values is not apologizing. Calling a despicable video what it is is not apologizing. Believe me, I am a strong believer in allowing Lavendar to be the despicable person he is. I am also a strong believer in calling him what he is--a despicable person. Same with the people who made this video. I don't apologize for him. I condemn him. So does America. The violence against random people we are seeing in the MidEast is despicable. The video is despicable. Obama is defending the right of Americans to produce that video, but by no means should he or any decent American defend the video. The violence is indefensible, but people around the world need to know that video was produced by a few despicable people. It does not represent America or our values. You shouldn't be ashamed to express that.

Topic.Title: Obama admin knew embasy attack probable but did not protect staff

Message.Msg: "the one spouting off before he knew anything about what was going on and making a fool of himself." Complete lack of self awareness.
